acknowledgements.para: C/1680 V1, also called the Great Comet of 1680, Kirch's Comet, and Newton's Comet, has the distinction of being the first comet discovered by telescope. The orbit of C/1680 V1, fit to a parabola, as shown in Isaac Newton's Principia. Isaac Newton used observations of C/1680 V1 to test and verify Kepler's laws of planetary motion.

Prior to discussion of SOLOR, the Department of Veterans Affairs's ISAAC (InformaticS Architecture Acceleration) must be referenced. ISAAC is an architecture framework that strives for a holistic approach to support an integrated delivery of iterative revisions of specifications, services, and content. ISAAC design philosophy calls for an approach that supports novelty within a rigorous—and vertically integrated—deployment pipeline and is based on existing software development best practices. Moreover, it embraces DevOps culture and practice by emphasizing collaboration and communication while automating the process of product delivery. The vision for development within the ISAAC framework is one that enables knowledge engineers, developers, testers, build managers, and operations personnel to work together effectively to deliver assets to the points of care and analysis.

Within the ISAAC architecture, KOMET (KnOwledge Management EnvironmenT) defines a modular system and a service platform for clinical knowledge management that implements a complete and dynamic component model. KOMET provides an environment for the modularization of knowledge resources into bundles. Each bundle is a tightly coupled, dynamically loadable collection of terminology, terminological knowledge assertions, A-Box assertions regarding rules, transformation, and files that explicitly declare their external dependencies—if any. To support the content within the ISAAC architecture, SOLOR's main goal is to provide an open-source terminology platform that cultivates the relationships between terminologies and allows knowledge to be shared in one consumable format. Moreover, it strives to remove the complexities of various content which are today delivered by isolated silo organizations who place the implementation burden upon their consumers.
